intro: Dissotis eximia, commonly known as the golden groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by orange to red berries containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
